What are you thankful for this week?: What are you thankful for this week?
What are you struggling with and how can: What are you struggling with and how can we help?
How did you put into practice the script: How did you put into practice the scripture/story we studied last time we met?
Who did you share last week's lesson wit: Who did you share last week's lesson with and how did it go?
What needs did you meet in the community: What needs did you meet in the community last week?
Ask someone to read the passage one para: Ask someone to read the passage one paragraph at a time.
Have a group member tell it in their own: Have a group member tell it in their own words.
Ask the group if they added anything or: Ask the group if they added anything or left anything out.
When you finish with ALL paragraphs, ask: When you finish with ALL paragraphs, ask someone in the group to tell the WHOLE story by memory. Have the group correct any errors.
What does this passage tell us about God: What does this passage tell us about God?
What does this passage tell us about peo: What does this passage tell us about people?
If this passage is true, what behaviour: If this passage is true, what behaviour should we change this week?
Who will you tell this story to this wee: Who will you tell this story to this week?
What needs can we meet in the community: What needs can we meet in the community this week?
When do you want to meet again?: When do you want to meet again?
Would you like to discover with your fri: Would you like to discover with your friends what God is like and how God want you to live?
Here are some questions to get your disc: Here are some questions to get your discussion started.
Would you like to discover for yourself: Would you like to discover for yourself what God is like and how God want you to live?
Most people like to make these discoveri: Most people like to make these discoveries in a group with their friends.
